1.text: Better is a dry morsel with joy, than a house full of victims with strife.

2.text: A wise servant shall rule over foolish sons, and shall divide the inheritance among the brethren.

3.text: As silver is tried by fire, and gold in the furnace: so the Lord trieth the hearts.

4.text: The evil man obeyeth an unjust tongue: and the deceitful hearkeneth to lying lips.

5.text: He that despiseth the poor, reproacheth his Maker; and he that rejoiceth at another man’s ruin, shall not be unpunished.

6.text: Children’s children are the crown of old men: and the glory of children are their fathers.

7.text: Eloquent words do not become a fool, nor lying lips a prince.

8.text: The expectation of him that expecteth, is a most acceptable jewel: whithersoever he turneth himself, he understandeth wisely.

9.text: He that concealeth a transgression. seeketh friendships: he that repeateth it again, separateth friends.

10.text: A reproof availeth more with a wise man, than a hundred stripes with a fool.

11.text: An evil man always seeketh quarrels: but a cruel angel shall be sent against him.

12.text: It is better to meet a bear robbed of her whelps, than a fool trusting in his own folly.

13.text: He that rendereth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

14.text: The beginning of quarrels is as when one letteth out water: before he suffereth reproach he forsaketh judgment.

15.text: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, both are abominable before God.

16.text: What doth it avail a fool to have riches, seeing he cannot buy wisdom? He that maketh his house high, seeketh a downfall: and he that refuseth to learn, shall fall into evils.

17.text: He that is a friend loveth at all times: and a brother is proved in distress.

18.text: A foolish man will clap hands, when he is surety for his friend.

19.text: He that studieth discords, loveth quarrels: and he that exalteth his door, seeketh ruin.

20.text: He that is of a perverse heart, shall not find good: and he that perverteth his tongue, shall fall into evil.

21.text: A fool is born to his own disgrace: and even his father shall not rejoice in a fool.

22.text: A joyful mind maketh age flourishing: a sorrowful spirit drieth up the bones.

23.text: The wicked man taketh gifts out of the bosom, that he may pervert the paths of judgment.

24.text: Wisdom shineth in the face of the wise: the eyes of fools are in the ends of the earth.

25.text: A foolish son is the anger of the father: and the sorrow of the mother that bore him.

26.text: It is no good thing to do hurt to the just: nor to strike the prince, who judgeth right.

27.text: He that setteth bounds to his words. is knowing and wise: and the man of understanding is of a precious spirit.

28.text: Even a fool, if he will hold his peace shall be counted wise: and if he close his lips, a man of understanding.
